message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.AI

The paper discusses a technique for detecting primary user emulation attacks in cognitive radio networks. This topic falls under the field of network security and communication systems, which are covered by several arXiv CS sub-categories. The most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), which covers research on network protocols, architectures, and security. The paper also discusses the use of Kalman filters, which are commonly used in control systems and signal processing, suggesting that cs.SY (Systems and Control) and cs.IT (Information Theory) are also likely categories. Additionally, the paper proposes a new approach for detecting attacks, which involves machine learning techniques, indicating that cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) may also be a relevant category. Finally, since the paper focuses on security attacks, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is also a possible category.
